page.title: 07KNOWLE GREEN
page.content: {KNOWLE GREEN}is a small hamlet a mile south of the main part of Belchamp St. Paul. It got it's name because of Hole Farm which is in 'an hole', and the meadow in the middle of the houses was once a 'green'. It was enclosed with a hawthorn hedge at the time of the {'Enclosures Act'.}There are 48 people living in Knowle Green - of whom 13 are old age pensioners, 8 are of school age, 1 is at college and 1 is under school age. The population has stayed constant even though there have been several houses built recently. Whereas as many as 10 people lived in a house, now there may be only 2. Cappers farmhouse has gone.{Woodbarns {Farm}is a listed building - the oldest part is built on tree trunks for foundations.{Hole Farm}is older than it's Georgian facade. There are two thatched cottages and a thatched inn.
